![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3073018/114276021-6dce4900-9a57-11eb-99c6-17842f40e217.png)
From a code point of view, whether type should be displayed here is the corresponding data type. @dailidong
`public static final String ORACLE_DB_CONNECT_TYPE = "connectType";`
@Jonathan-Wei The type is connectType, it is only used by Oracle. This has been mentioned in #5083, this make confusion, and will be solved.
I know that the type attribute here should be the corresponding data source type, and here the connectType value is assigned to the type attribute @ruanwenjun
I will fix it. please assign it to me!
Type and ConnectType have the same value? @ruanwenjun
@Jonathan-Wei Yeah, you are right, we need to distinguish the type and connectType here, and I think the type does not need to be stored in paramMap.

It's OK not to display the type at all. For now, the buildParameter() method splits the null value into the connectionParams parameter during processing, causing the type to be displayed as null @ruanwenjun
@Jonathan-Wei We can remove line 491.
Yes. Let me change this. I submitted it for the first time; Ha ha @ruanwenjun

@ruanwenjun please review this PR, thanks

```
# resource.storage.type=HDFS
resource.storage.type=HDFS

# resource store on HDFS/S3 path, resource file will store to this hadoop hdfs path, self configuration, please make sure the directory exists on hdfs and have read write permissions"/dolphinscheduler" is recommended
resource.upload.path=/dolphinscheduler

# user data local directory path, please make sure the directory exists and have read write permissions
#data.basedir.path=/tmp/dolphinscheduler

# whether kerberos starts
hadoop.security.authentication.startup.state=false

# java.security.krb5.conf.path=/home/maintain/ds-1.3.4/conf/krb5.conf
java.security.krb5.conf.path=/home/maintain/ds-1.3.4/conf/krb5.conf

# login user from keytab username
login.user.keytab.username=hdfs-mycluster@ESZ.COM

# loginUserFromKeytab path
login.user.keytab.path=/home/maintain/ds-1.3.4/conf/hdfs.headless.keytab

#resource.view.suffixs
#resource.view.suffixs=txt,log,sh,conf,cfg,py,java,sql,hql,xml,properties

# if resource.storage.type=HDFS
hdfs.root.user=maintain

# if resource.storage.type=HDFS
fs.defaultFS=hdfs://hadooptest:8020

# if resource.storage.type=HDFS
fs.s3a.endpoint=http://192.168.xx.xx:9010

# if resource.storage.type=HDFS
fs.s3a.access.key=xxxxxxxxxx

# if resource.storage.type=HDFS
fs.s3a.secret.key=xxxxxxxxxx

# if resourcemanager HA enable, please type the HA ips ; if resourcemanager is single, make this value empty
yarn.resourcemanager.ha.rm.ids=alibjhtest-pipe-sata1-vm,alibjhtest-pipe-sata2-vm

# if resourcemanager HA enable or not use resourcemanager, please keep the default value; If resourcemanager is single, you only need to replace ds1 to actual resourcemanager hostname.
yarn.application.status.address=http://yarnIp1:8088/ws/v1/cluster/apps/%s

# system env path
dolphinscheduler.env.path=/home/maintain/ds-1.3.4/conf/env/dolphinscheduler_env.sh
development.state=false
kerberos.expire.time=7
```
Merged.
